meanings.definition: To clear from accusation or blame.
meanings.sent1: The evidence presented in court helped exonerate the suspect.
meanings.sent2: The judge decided to exonerate the defendant due to lack of proof.
meanings.sent3: After the detective found the real culprit, they were able to exonerate the wrongly accused person.
meanings.sent4: The new information completely exonerated the suspect, proving their innocence.
meanings.sent5: The DNA test results were crucial in exonerating the wrongly convicted individual.

meanings.definition: To free from guilt or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: The confession of the true perpetrator helped exonerate the innocent party.
meanings.sent2: The new alibi evidence was able to exonerate the suspect from any wrongdoing.
meanings.sent3: The magical spell cast by the fairy was able to exonerate the princess from the curse.
meanings.sent4: The heartfelt apology served as a way to exonerate him from the guilt he carried for years.
meanings.sent5: The forgiveness from his family finally exonerated him from the burden of past mistakes.
